definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: Teutonic, based on an old Latin quote, or
sentences.chinese: 它来自条顿语，这一猜测基于一条古拉丁语的引述。

sentences.english: He cites control strategies such as culling and vaccination of birds.
sentences.chinese: 他引述了像家禽剔杀和免疫这样的控制战略。

sentences.english: Such Biblical references are a valuable working-tool in catechesis.
sentences.chinese: 圣经的引述是教理讲授的工具之一。

sentences.english: The comedian's ad-libs were quoted in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 那喜剧演员的脱口妙语被引述在报纸上。

sentences.english: When you're getting your term life insurance quote, ask about a guaranteed insurability rider.
sentences.chinese: 当你得到你的任期寿险引述打听保证保险竞速。

sentences.english: He is frequently quoted in national and global news outlets.
sentences.chinese: 他经常引述的国家和全球的新闻点。

sentences.english: Let me quote him in greater length.
sentences.chinese: 我再引述他另一句更长的话。
引述与引用写法也各异。

sentences.english: He quotes some students from the University of Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 他引述了几位密歇根大学学生的话。

sentences.english: TTC Lao Tzu. Tao Te Ching. Reference is to section number.
sentences.chinese: 《道德经》，引述时标记的数位指的是每一节的编号。

sentences.english: The names mentioned on the cables are political veterans, not just any Tom, Dick, or Harry.
sentences.chinese: 电报引述的人物都是政坛翘楚，皆非等闲之辈。

sentences.english: 'I only said I had done some research there, ' the newspaper quoted him as saying.
sentences.chinese: 报纸引述他的话称，我只说过我在那里做过一些研究。

sentences.english: The government speaker complained that the newspapers had misquoted him.
sentences.chinese: 这位政府发言人抱怨报纸错误地引述了他讲的话。

sentences.english: I wish on this subject to adduce a modern example.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个问题，我想引述当代的一个例子。

sentences.english: Let me premise my argument with a bit of history.
sentences.chinese: 让我引述一些史实然后摆出我的观点。

definition: to quote/to cite/to recommend (one's friend's, associates etc)
South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)
